page.title: 15THE LOCAL GALA
page.content: The annual Boltby, Felixkirk, Sutton and Thirlby Gala began in 1977 as a celebration of the Queen's Silver Jubilee for all the children of the 4 villages. The event moves from village to village on a rota system. This year it was Sutton's turn again and the event was held at Aspen Grove Farm the home of Mr & Mrs M. Wheldon. The children decorated a trailer on Friday evening with the village colours and rode on it at lunchtime on 6 July to the gala field. The afternoon began as usual with a fancy dress parade. This was followed by the cross country and games for all ages. Points are awarded for all the games and the winning village is awarded the cup. The host village provideds a sit-down tea for the 400 participants.
